intro: Diaphananthe ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda diaphananthe, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Uganda. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
